intro: Calandriniopsis umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella calandriniopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in association with other aquatic or semi-aquatic vegetation.
